page.title: 17PLAYGROUND GAMES AND RHYMES
page.content: Every year the same favourite games are played, in the autumn the{Conker} season arrives, followed by{Pinball. After Christmas{Marbles}emerge and are popular with both sexes and all ages. {British Bulldog}is a tig game and{Cats {and Dogs}is a team game.{Hopscotch}is favoured by the younger children and, of course,{Skipping.}There are various obligatory{rhymes }that go with the skipping games,{Fairies and witches, {crocodiles stitches,}is a familiar one and the old{Salt, mustard, vinegar, {pepper,}and{Queen queen Caroline, which goes with a{ball game.}Also {clapping games}have appeared recently because of television programmes showing American games.{Dipping rhymes are still used to choose who will be "on".{Dip, dip, dip,my little ship, {sails on the water, like a cup and {saucer, you're not it! }
